definitions.definition: Of two objects, at right angles; perpendicular to each other.
definitions.example: A chord and the radius that bisects it are orthogonal.

definitions.definition: Of a pair of vectors: having a zero inner product; perpendicular.
definitions.example: The normal vector and tangent vector at a given point are orthogonal.

definitions.definition: Of a square matrix: such that its transpose is equal to its inverse.
Of a linear transformation: preserving its angles.
Of grid graphs, board games and polyominoes: vertical or horizontal but not diagonal.
Of a pair of elements in an ortholattice: each less than or equal to the orthocomplement of the other.
Statistically independent, with reference to variates.
Of two or more aspects of a problem, able to be treated separately.
definitions.example: The content of the message should be orthogonal to the means of its delivery.

definitions.definition: Of two or more problems or subjects, independent of or irrelevant to each other.
